clanmuramasa.quote: 对钢铁的信仰,无处不在.
clanmuramasa.description: Clan Muramasa has faith in their steel, and are steely in their faith. Samurai warriors wield swords of exquisite sharpness and quality.

yamato.description: 宽阔起伏的丘陵和宽阔的湖泊. 村正一族氏族的默认聚落之地.

spring.description: 大和山的春天是重生的季节,将持续三个月. 雨水融化了雪,露出隐藏在其下的新生植物,树木重生,开满了五颜六色的花朵.

summer.description: 大和山的夏天是炎热的季节,将持续三个月.现在是放松和晒太阳的时候,但是强风会带来雷暴或沙尘暴.

autumn.description: 大和山的秋天是收获季节,将持续三个月.树木变成金黄色,草地开始进入过冬状态,因为天空乌云密布.

winter.description: 大和山的冬天是一个寒冷的季节,将持续三个月.许多树木落下了叶子,大雪覆盖了这片大地.最好在炉子周围舒适地聚会以抵御寒风刺骨.

dual_wield_knight.description: 目前,这名武士更喜欢一起使用主手武器和副手武器(双持). 点击更改!

clanmuramasa_archer.description: 目前,这位弓箭手更喜欢穿村正盔甲.点击更改!

clanmuramasa_cleric.description: 目前,这位牧师更喜欢穿村正盔甲.点击更改!

clanmuramasa_footman.description: 目前,这位战士更喜欢穿村正盔甲.点击更改!

clanmuramasa_knight.description: 目前,这位骑士更喜欢穿村正盔甲.点击更改!

shop_info.title: 村正商人贩运的武器和装甲已抵达

shop_info.name: 钢制商品店

bulletin_message.00:
Greetings, members of Muramasa. My name is Amaterasu.
To farm our staple crop, Rice, there are unique requirements: a flooded field on land, and sunlight to grow properly.

First, an area can be dug out of the land to hold water, and then the Rice crop can be planted on the submerged soil. This can be done naturally near a lake or river, but water can also be placed where you choose by using these gifts:

"The Wet Stone:" An area can be filled with water by placing this summon stone that emits liquid.
"The Dry Stone:" A summon stone which can dry up nearby moisture, if there is too much in the way.

Hello again, members of Muramasa. You have grown, through your dedication and resolve. I applaud you.

Now, I offer to you another gift, full of the natural magic of our world, Hearth. With this talisman, a member can tap into Hearth magic to alter the land, using Geomancy. Using the essence harvested from Hearthbud plants, they will create great things!

"Amaterasu disappears into the light."
Place these plants somewhere to harvest their essence:

Once you have made your choice, please record them on the provided forms and send them back with Tanuki. And please be sure to feed him before he leaves. He prefers berries, but he'll accept prickly pears as well.

Be safe,
Shogun Talkugawa,
Imperial Shogunate

A determined-looking tanuki approaches, carrying in its snout a leather satchel with "Imperial Shogunate Official Mail" stitched onto it. He drops it by the town standard and settles down, looking up expectantly.

open_letter.choice_001: [skip] We know what banner we want.

bulletin_message.00:
Dear Ensei [str(i18n_data.town_serial_number)],

Thank you for volunteering to establish a new outpost here! We here at the Imperial Shogunate are delighted that you chose us to facilitate your founding.

Once the paperwork is in order, this outpost will be recognized by Emperor Nobunaga.

To start, in order for us to record your outpost, you must choose a name, as well as a Standard.

The Standard declares to the rest of Clan Muramasa the purpose behind you settling down, though we have found that it is even more effective at inspiring an outpost's own people.
Apparently, Tanuki also brought a bag of food items, and Tanuki's satchel contains a smaller satchel full of coins, labeled "Outpost Founding Incentive".
Once the outpost founding forms are filled and back in their satchel, Tanuki picks it up and starts on his journey back to the closest Imperial Shogunate office.
The messenger tanuki returns, with a reply from Talkugawa.

Conversely, we expect you to start considering the next step in your Outpost's evolution. Although most of our partner outposts opt to focus on trade, we think other approaches to prosperity are equally valuable to Clan Muramasa, and it is always up to the Outpost themselves to make that decision.

Be safe!
Shogun Talkugawa
Imperial Shogunate


P.S. A small gift for you, for good luck ✨

Congratulations on your Founding!

Your Outpost is now officially in the Imperial record, and I trust that you're well on your way to becoming our primary contact in the region!
To help you achieve this worthy goal, we'll spread the news of your outpost, encouraging brave travellers to head to [str(i18n_data.town_name)].
A Hearth of Makers, on the other hand, is for those who believe that a town's value is its work, and that its work is best measured in gold.
Cheer, Glory, or Makers - the choice is entirely yours. Think of what matters most to your Settlement, and follow that beacon into the future!

As you know, Hearths have been the cornerstone of Settlements all the way back to the Phoenix Empire.

If not for their glow, brave new settlers would never find their way easily, and our society would have scattered long ago. The type of Hearth also says much about what a Settlement values.
For instance, a Hearth of Cheer is for those who believe that a town's value is found in being a happy home for its citizens.
Finally, a Hearth of Glory is for those who believe that there comes a time when negotiations no longer suffice, and the land has to be protected by force.

Hello! This time I am personally visiting in an official capacity, to view your Outpost. We at the Imperial Shogunate are very impressed with your Outpost's progress, and have decided that it's time to officially update your member status to that of 'Settlement'.

Before we can do that, though, it is customary to choose a Hearth to represent your town.

intro.choice_001: [skip] We know what Hearth we want.

bulletin_message.00:
I am currently making arrangements to visit your Settlement myself, and when I do, I will be bringing along several individuals who have expressed interest in guiding up and coming Settlements like yours. These are highly regarded members of our society, so be sure to have your best meals ready!

Bless you!
Shogun Talkugawa
Imperial Shogunate

Dear [str(i18n_data.town_name)]-ites,

I have received many reports from our community partners singing your Settlement all kinds of praises. I am so glad that our investment in your Outpost is bearing fruit so quickly!

As you may remember from our contract, the final service we offer any Outpost under our guidance is to connect them to some distinguished members of Clan Muramasa society, who can help them cross that final bridge to becoming a Town.
Talkugawa is getting in touch with us again!

Hello, [str(i18n_data.town_name)]!

I'm so glad to get to see your Settlement here today!

Well, let's move on to business. Here are the potential guides I mentioned in my last letter. Please take a moment to hear what they have to say.

Greetings again, brothers and sisters! I am Amaterasu, here to visit you all. I have been exploring the world and finding out all its secrets. One way I work towards this is by guiding towns here, far from the heart of the capital region.

In return for guidance, I typically ask a Settlement to build a Cleyera Shrine, to serve as a constant reminder that the world is a mysterious place, rife with opportunities for exploration and learning. Once the shrine is blessed, it will spread its magical effects among your populace, empowering them in strange and mysterious ways.

Dedicating a Cleyera Shrine will grant all of your townsfolk a +1 boost to the Mind, Body, and Spirit attributes.

Come here, people! I'm Shokuzen, a Master Crafter of the Za Guild, and an admirer of this budding little Settlement of yours. So efficient! So promising! I've visited a few young Settlements, but I never tire of seeing good, hardworking Clan members settling down and expanding the reach of our trading routes.

Shokuzen produces a handful of wagashi treats from his pocket and distributes them among the group.

As you know, the Crafting Guild is the main sponsor of Clan Muramasa Towns, so I'm sure you aren't surprised to see me here. We would love to have you join the Guild - I think your Settlement can produce and export some of the finest goods Clan Muramasa has to offer, and keep the tradition of excellency that we are known for.

Dedicating a Hinamatsuri Shrine will grant the ability to create Masterwork-quality furniture and decorations, which are considerably better than those of Excellent quality.

Hey! I am Oni! You probably haven't heard of me yet, but I'm the leader of The Defenders, a group of fighters trying to make sure our peaceful ways survive the hardships of the modern world, be it goblin raids or undead infestations, by training Clan Muramasa in various self defense techniques. And now we are looking for Settlements to join our numbers!

We think your people have shown that they have the strength needed to protect this Settlement, and even some of your neighbors, so we'd like you to build a Kami Shrine to be a beacon of strength in these lands, and in return we will share some of our latest weapon and armor schematics.

Dedicating the Kami Shrine will grant you recipes for new, highest-tier weapons.

So! Now you've met everyone, and my job as the facilitator is coming to a close. I don't want to influence your choice, but I can assure you they're all very powerful and can help your town achieve its full potential.

I'll leave the plans for each of the shrines and whatnot with your Carpenter.

It's been a pleasure visiting, and I'm looking forward to seeing you again at the dedication ceremony!

guildmaster.name: Hinamatsuri Shrine
guildmaster.description:
This Township shall be known for its productivity, wealth, and craftsmanship.
  • Allows crafting Masterwork quality items
  • Unlocks homely decoration recipes

deity.name: Cleyera Shrine
deity.description:
This Township shall seek to learn the secrets of the world, in service of Amaterasu.
  • Blesses all citizens with +1 to Mind, Body, and Spirit
  • Unlocks gold decoration recipes

valor.name: Kami Shrine
valor.description:
This Township shall be dedicated to the protection of the whole surrounding region.
  • Unlocks legendary weapon recipes
  • Unlocks exotic decoration recipes

shrine_upgrade_deity.title: Township Established
shrine_upgrade_deity.reward_message: By decree of the Imperial Shogunate, we recognize:
shrine_upgrade_deity.reward_message_ctd: For learning the mysteries of the world. The town is hereby eligible for:

shrine_upgrade_guildmaster.reward_message: By decree of the Imperial Shogunate, we recognize:
shrine_upgrade_guildmaster.reward_message_ctd: For excellence in craftsmanship. The town is hereby eligible for:

recipe_bulletins.recipe_unlock_potter: New pot, floral, and workbench decoration recipes for Potter!
recipe_bulletins.recipe_unlock_mason: New fountain decoration recipes for Mason!

shrine_upgrade_valor.reward_message: By decree of the Imperial Shogunate, we recognize:
shrine_upgrade_valor.reward_message_ctd: For acts of incredible valor in combat. The town is hereby eligible for:

achievements.003: Weaver Banners, Throws, and Cushions Recipes

recipe_bulletins.recipe_unlock_weaver: New banner, throw, and cushion recipes for Weaver!

bulletin_message.00:
Of course, with our backing, everyone will know that when you call something a 'Masterwork', you mean it! It's in the bylaws, after all.

I have no doubt that traders will soon be going out of their way to pay your Town a visit. I'd expect lots of company!

Alright, enough with all this business talk - I'm going to find a spry young lady and get to dancing!

What? You're only as old as you act!

(Shokuzen nods, mumbling to himself. 'Hmm... yes, I suppose this will do nicely, nicely indeed.')

Oh! Muramasa, you have chosen well to sign on as part of the Crafter Guild's network, and we are certainly glad to have you!

msg1.bulletin_title: Shokuzen leans in, examining the Shrine

bulletin_message.00:
Ha! I guess that's true!

So, we scrounged up some weapon designs from dusty old tomes forgotten and stashed away - I brought some copies along to give out to your crafters, so they can try and work out how to put 'em together.

msg2.choice_000: I'm sure they'll figure it out!

bulletin_message.00:
No doubt!

Alright, I've been on my feet all day, so I'm gonna go grab a bowl or a slice of something! Congratulations!

Wow, I bet this can be seen from miles off! Those goblins will be running scared before long!

I'm so glad you decided to sign up with us - there's not too many of us Defenders yet, but we're growing fast because of Towns like you!

Henceforth, this blessed Shrine will bestow a little of my power upon each of you.

Ponder it. Take that curiosity out into the world with you as you trade, or explore, or welcome strangers into your Town hoping to overhear some tantalizing new bit of information.
Of course, we at the Temple will expect a regular report of any goings on. That can wait, though - for now, it's time for all of us to eat, drink, and be merry!

Blessings to you, sisters and brothers. What a suitable shrine you've built!

I especially enjoy the cute kitty statue!

Wonderful, wonderful! Your Town certainly does the Muramasa name proud!

Thank you for throwing such a nice reception for me and our guests.

This monument we're celebrating about is special, by the way - a Town's founding imbues a special sort magic into it.

Building more statues and such can serve decorative purposes, but they won't have the same sort of glow, if you know what I mean.

(Yap! Yap!)

Yes, yes, Tanuki, I know, it's time to go.

I'd love to stay longer, but there's other, less self-sufficient adventurers out there that need my attention.

Congratulations on all your success, and thanks for not having ever made too much paperwork for me.

Blessings, friend! Now that our existing contract is resolved, we'd like to remind you that the Imperial Shogunate is always open for repeat business!

In fact, since this collaboration went so well, if you'd like to establish another town, we'd be happy to sponsor a large embarkment crew that can carry a few of your citizens from here, as well as some extra goods and records. Just let us know when you're ready!

Re-embarking allows you to carry over up to 3 citizens, 10 items, and all your unlocked recipes when starting a new town.

freezing_field_work_outfit.description: Warm. Worn by field workers in cold seasons. Protects from freezing weather.

worker_description.description: Peasants perform basic tasks like harvesting resources, hauling stuff around, and constructing buildings, in addition to tending the fields.
worker_description.requirements: None, just hard work and guts.

peasant_mill_ghost.description: Used by a Peasant to grind grains into flour.

peasant_workbench_ghost.description: Used by the Peasant for meager recipes.

peasant_workbench_recipe.description: Use to cook fairly basic meals.
peasant_workbench_recipe.flavor: Stone, to keep the food hot for a long time.

banner_trading_ghost.description: How you know you've come home.
banner_trading_ghost.town_bonus_description:
This settlement will be a bustling hub of trade.
  • Roads give 3x their normal speed boost
  • Your items sell for 50% more
  • Traders will bring 2x the goods and Gold

banner_trading_token_iconic.description: A shred from the Banner of Trading, carrying along its blessing.

banner_mining_ghost.description: How you know you've come home
banner_mining_ghost.town_bonus_description:
This settlement will grow strong through earth and steel.
  • Mining gives 50% more Ore, Stone, and Clay
  • Hearthlings no longer mind cramped spaces

banner_mining_token_iconic.description: A shred from the Banner of Mining, carrying along its blessing.

banner_growing_ghost.description: How you know you've come home
banner_growing_ghost.town_bonus_description:
This settlement shall be at one with the environment.
  • Trees produce 25% more Wood
  • Plants and Crops both grow 25% faster
  • Plants have 2x their normal Appeal

banner_growing_token_iconic.description: A shred from the Banner of Growing, carrying along its blessing.

shoji_sliding_door_squares_ghost.description: A classic detailed wood sliding door

shoji_sliding_wall_door_ghost.description: A sliding door, same width as Shoji wall panels

paddy_crop_cm.description: Rice grows slowly and works both as a grain and a vegetable!

001.name: Paddy Tuft
001.description: It's growing taller by the minute!

002.description: Long grasses have emerged and will flower anytime.

003.description: The grasses are bright green and the windsown seeds will dry soon.

004.description: The ears have dried and the paddy is ready for harvest!

susuki.description: This plant's fiber can be spun into thread.
susuki.unripe_description: This plant has been harvested and hasn't grown back yet.

susuki_bud.description: It's almost there!  Look, it has buds!

susuki_plant_ace.description: Can be harvested for fibers and green bitter herbs.
